justification: "Moral dilemmas: The 4CONFiDE moral set described in Cecchetto et al… The first two were considered to be utilitarian… whereas the second two choices were considered to be non-utilitarian", indicating the set is used to measure the type of moral choice.
"Then participants performed the odor identification test 41", referring to the standard Sniffin’ Sticks identification test as the tool to assess odor identification.
"Perceptual ratings for odor intensity… were collected on a 10-point computerized VAS, ranging from 'not at all' to 'very much'."
The same sentence notes that pleasantness ratings were gathered "on a 10-point computerized VAS," linking pleasantness perception to this scale.
The procedure also states that familiarity was assessed with the identical "10-point computerized VAS," establishing the measure for odor familiarity.
